==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|swær}}, from {{inh|de|goh|swār}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*swēraz}}, from {{der|de|ine-pro|*swer-|t=heavy, grave, serious}}. Cognate with {{cog|en|sweer}} and {{cog|la|sērius}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ʃveːɐ̯/}} * {{audio|de|De-schwer.ogg|audio (Germany)}} * {{audio|de|De-at-schwer.ogg|audio (Austria)}} * {{rhymes|de|eːɐ̯}} ===Adjective=== {{de-adj|er|sten}} # [[heavy]], [[weighty]] #* '''1921''', [[w:de:Elisabeth von Heyking|Elisabeth von Heyking]], ''[[s:de:Die Trommel|Die Trommel]]'', in ''Weberin Schuld'', G. Grote'sche Verlagsbuchhandlung, page 18: #*: Und sie ging gebückt, als trage sie eine '''schwere''' Last, […] #*:: And she walked bowed as if she carried a heavy load, […] # [[difficult]], [[hard]] # [[serious]] # [[indigestible]] (food) ====Declension==== {{de-decl-adj|schwer|schwerer|schwerst}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|schwergängig}} * {{l|de|schwerhörig}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}}
